sn55.31:1.2: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.
sn55.31:1.4: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.31:1.6: This is the first kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:2.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …
sn55.31:2.3: This is the second kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:3.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha …
sn55.31:3.3: This is the third kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:4.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
sn55.31:4.2: This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.
sn55.31:4.3: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”
